result.execSummary:
The defendant Devin K Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Becky Van Dam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Devin K Williams in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail-PO Hold), with attorney Jorge R. Fragoso.

Amended Information filed.

Defendant enters a No Contest plea to the amended count 1.
Defendant enters a Guilty plea to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.

Court orders the following:
Count 1:
80 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions)
Concurrent to count 2.
88 Days Credit
Time Served.

Costs:  $243
DNA Surcharge: Court Waives.
To be paid forthwith - In Lieu of payment 5 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Consecutive - Time Served/Paid in Full

Count 2:
80 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions)
Concurrent to count 1.
Time Served.

Costs:  $243
DNA Surcharge:  Court Waived.
To be paid forthwith - In Lieu of payment 5  Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Consecutive - Time Served/Paid in Full
